feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale southwesterly gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Watch upgraded to an Orange Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southwest winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Watch seperated from Auckland and Coromandel Peninsula.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Westerly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southwesterly winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Rain is expected to turn to snow for a time this evening and tonight. Up to 1 cm may accumulate about higher parts of the road, with less down to 500 metres tonight. Note, further snow expected later on Sunday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers are affecting the road Saturday morning down to about 700 metres. Expect another 1 to 3 cm to accumulate on higher parts of the road. Snow may briefly turn to rain Saturday afternoon, but snow is expected from evening again when up to 1 cm may accumulate above 600 metres. Note, further snow expected during Sunday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Rain is expected to turn to snow for a time this evening and tonight. Up to 2 to 3 cm may accumulate about higher parts of the road, with less down to 400 metres tonight. Note, further snow expected later on Sunday.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
